column4: my mouse pointer will not click on my desktop or right-click, any ideas what could be wrong? I am on hardy, havent done anything different to cause it
my mouse pointer will not click on my desktop or right-click, any ideas what could be wrong? I am on hardy, havent done anything different to cause it
I've got KDE4 and Gnome installed simultaneously on my OpenSuse11 distro install without any problems... Why would it be that much different for Ubuntu?

because they share the same repos, everything is available to the user then, all gnome apps that bwere installed as well as for kde, so it actually causes some instability-that was my experience, which is not unique
just use mkfs
i'm not familiar with mkfs
can you elaborate plz?
type man mkfs in a terminal :)
doh! lol, thankz

If say for example your usb drive was /dev/sdd, then you would want to I guess first use fdisk, so sudo fdisk /dev/sdd, then create a primary partition of type FAT32, once you do that, you'd do mkfs.vfat -F 32 /dev/sdd1
I get this: http://paste.ubuntu.com/23351/
first you need to do sudo fdisk -l to find what the device is called, paste me that output
http://paste.ubuntu.com/23352/
huh? you typed exactly this: sudo fdisk -l and got that as an output?
yeah
see, the reason i need to format is, there is no data on the disk, its 1 GB, but it says there is only 165MB's of available memory
I'm confused about the output of your sudo fdisk -l
I've never seen that before
Not to be rude, but you definitely typed sudo fdisk -l (that's a lowercase L)
for sure, mate
I've got no clue then, sorry
I tried googling that error, and there are only two pages that even list that... Try posting on the forums, cause it's definitely pretty obscure
